required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Standard Operating Procedures for Anti-HPV (Human Papillomavirus) Antibody Detection in First-void Urine
clinical_study.official_title: Study for the Development of Standard Operating Procedures for Anti-HPV Antibody Detection in First-void Urine: the AB-SOP Follow-up Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to develop robust analytical protocols for first-void urine sample preparation and antibody assays to monitor vaccine induced immunity against HPV (Human Papillomavirus).

detailed_description.textblock: Participants of the HPV V503-004 study (Phase III Clinical trial vaccinating (young) adult women in Antwerp, EudraCT NUMBER: 2015-005093-38) will be asked if they are willing to provide two additional urine samples at day 1 and month 7 for biomedical research. The collected urine will be used for the development and optimisation of robust analytical protocols for sample preparation and antibody assays.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration of HPV specific IgG (Immunoglobulin G) in FV urine.
primary_outcome.description: To detect HPV specific IgG concentrations (ratio HPV specific IgG/total human IgG), in first-void urine from 64 women to monitor the immune response before and after vaccination with a prophylactic HPV vaccine (Gardasil9).

intervention.description: Collection of first-void urine (i.e. the initial stream of the urine void) with the Colli-PeeTM device (Novosanis).

study_pop.textblock: In total 64 women are included in this trial. During their study visit at day 0 and 7m post-vaccination, participants are asked to collect a first-void urine sample with the Colli-PeeTM device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant of the HPV V503-004 study at UA/UZA
- Signing informed consent form (ICF)

facility.name: university of Antwerp - centre for the evaluation of vaccination
